metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5753 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis. Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Spectre. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5753` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Variant 1, aka "Spectre" The break-fix lines for this CVE are not complete since a large number of patches are required to mitigate this issue. The commit(s) listed are chosen as placeholders for automated CVE triage purposes.

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-112.135').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1049.58').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9023.24').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was pending').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1017.22').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
